question.questionText: Why do both bulbs A and B stay on when bulb C is burned out?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: If C burns out then A and B are still in a closed path with the battery
There is a closed path with A and B that C is not in.
If C is damaged, A and B are still in a closed path
A and B have their own path
There is still a closed path

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: because bulbs a and b are in a closed path with the battery
